plot.topic: Everything you should know about building and running a micro SaaS

chapters.chapter_title: What Micro SaaS Actually Is (and Is Not)
chapters.chapter_summary: Defines micro SaaS as a capital-efficient, narrowly scoped software business optimized for profitability, control, and sustainability rather than venture-scale growth.
chapters.include: bootstrapping vs venture scale, founder leverage, small teams or solo founders, revenue ceilings, control vs speed tradeoffs
chapters.avoid: romanticized indie hacking, overnight success myths, vague entrepreneurship slogans

chapters.chapter_summary: Examines how time, energy, skill asymmetry, and opportunity cost shape viable micro SaaS strategies.
chapters.include: solo-founder constraints, leverage per hour, founder-market fit, personal risk tolerance, lifestyle vs ambition tension
chapters.avoid: infinite hustle assumptions, copying VC-backed playbooks
backreferences: What Micro SaaS Actually Is (and Is Not)

chapters.chapter_summary: Explains why micro SaaS success depends on choosing painful, recurring, narrowly defined problems with identifiable buyers.
chapters.include: jobs-to-be-done, willingness to pay, niche B2B markets, frequency vs severity of pain
chapters.avoid: broad consumer ideas, TAM obsession, idea-first thinking
backreferences: What Micro SaaS Actually Is (and Is Not)

chapters.chapter_title: Customer Discovery Without Lying to Yourself
chapters.chapter_summary: Covers how to validate demand honestly, avoiding confirmation bias and fake signals.
chapters.include: problem interviews, pre-selling, demand proxies, rejection signals, explicit vs implicit feedback
chapters.avoid: survey theater, vanity waitlists, friends-and-family validation

chapters.chapter_title: Product Scope, Simplicity, and Technical Leverage
chapters.chapter_summary: Details how successful micro SaaS products constrain scope while maximizing leverage through automation, integrations, and boring technology.
chapters.include: single-core feature focus, API-first thinking, build vs buy, maintenance cost awareness

chapters.chapter_title: Architecture for Longevity, Not Bragging Rights
chapters.chapter_summary: Explains technical choices that reduce cognitive load, failure modes, and long-term maintenance risk.
chapters.include: monolith bias, managed services, dependency minimization, failure containment, operational simplicity
chapters.avoid: distributed systems cosplay, custom infrastructure, resume-driven design
backreferences: Product Scope, Simplicity, and Technical Leverage

chapters.chapter_title: Pricing, Revenue Models, and Cash Discipline
chapters.chapter_summary: Analyzes pricing as the dominant growth lever in micro SaaS and why early monetization beats user growth.
chapters.include: value-based pricing, simple subscriptions, annual plans, churn math, break-even thinking
chapters.avoid: free-first strategies, ad-based models, vanity metrics
backreferences: Product Scope, Simplicity, and Technical Leverage
Customer Discovery Without Lying to Yourself

chapters.chapter_summary: Breaks down the economic reality of micro SaaS, focusing on margins, churn, and time-to-profitability.
chapters.include: LTV/CAC realism, gross margin awareness, support cost per customer, pricing floor logic
backreferences: Pricing, Revenue Models, and Cash Discipline

chapters.chapter_summary: Explains why distribution is the real bottleneck and how credibility compounds faster than reach.
chapters.include: founder-led sales, authority-building content, niche communities, SEO patience, targeted outbound
chapters.avoid: growth hacks, viral fantasies, generic social posting
backreferences: Pricing, Revenue Models, and Cash Discipline
Customer Discovery Without Lying to Yourself

chapters.chapter_title: Sales as a System, Not a Personality Trait
chapters.chapter_summary: Reframes sales as a learnable, repeatable process critical to micro SaaS survival.
chapters.include: qualification, objection handling, demos, closing mechanics, expectation setting

chapters.chapter_title: Operations, Support, and Hidden Time Sinks
chapters.chapter_summary: Explores the operational reality of running micro SaaS and how support, bugs, and edge cases consume founder time.
chapters.include: support triage, documentation leverage, automation, SLA realism
chapters.avoid: hero support mentality, ignoring operational drag
backreferences: Architecture for Longevity, Not Bragging Rights

chapters.chapter_summary: Describes how micro SaaS grows through steady optimization rather than step-function breakthroughs.
chapters.include: pricing iteration, conversion tuning, churn reduction, incremental UX improvements
backreferences: Pricing, Revenue Models, and Cash Discipline
Operations, Support, and Hidden Time Sinks

chapters.chapter_title: Risk Management, Failure Modes, and When to Quit
chapters.chapter_summary: Provides a rational framework for shutting down, selling, or pausing a micro SaaS without emotional distortion.
chapters.include: kill criteria, opportunity cost analysis, shutdown checklists, asset reuse
chapters.avoid: sunk-cost fallacy, identity attachment to products
